Issues.Title: About UpdateLayout method detect dead loop, why is there a magic number 153?
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/64b105766c64b379a4edd544e1a95c07af8d6e34/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/PresentationCore/System/Windows/LayoutManager.cs#L231C21-L231C36
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/25047407/ad64b76c-00d7-4e2a-abde-6bdcd09ddc11)

Itâ€˜s a magic number. Seems if the MeasureQueue or ArrangeQueue's length exceeds a number around it, the UpdateLayout method will call itself in Background. So is there any reason and why is it must be 153?

Is there a possibility if there are too many controls rending at same time, it will be regarded as a dead loop? And then it will call UpdateLayout again in background. Seems it will be endless. 

Anyone knows about it?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "About UpdateLayout method detect dead loop, why is there a magic number 153?" (#7978)

### !! NO MERGE !!

#138 

## Description
This PR is to test the integration of tests written in #138 with the build flow of WPF.  The aim here is to understand the changes required to run the tests on the pipeline. Once, we verify that tests run are running on pipeline, this PR will be closed.


<!-- Give a brief summary of the issue and how the pull request is fixing it. -->

Provides the team with relevant information to setup test infra for running unit tests on pipeline.

Issues.Title: Is WPF Supported on Windows Nano Server?
Issues.Body:
### Description

On .NET Core 3.1 it was possible to run a WPF console app on Windows Nano Server. There is no UI, only usage of the Geometry classes in System.Windows.Media.Media3D. No typeface classes are used (as in #3609).

See this post: https://blog.tonysneed.com/2020/07/04/run-wpf-in-net-core-on-nano-server-in-docker. And this repo: https://github.com/tonysneed/hello-netcore-wpf-nano

However, when attempting to port the app to .NET 6, running the app results in a `DllNotFoundException` for **dwrite.dll**.

This error is not generated when running the container on a Windows Server Core base image.

### Reproduction Steps

Clone this repo: https://github.com/mpospisil/dotnet-runtime-windowsdesktop/tree/main/Examples/WpfConsole/WpfConsole

Build Windows container image: `docker build -t wpf-console .`
Run the container: `docker run -it wpf-console`

### Expected behavior

Able to create a `Point3D` object from a WPF console app running on Windows Nano Server.

### Actual behavior

Executing WPF console app on Nano server produces the following error.

```
Unhandled exception. System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for '<Module>' threw an exception.
 ---> System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for '<Module>' threw an exception.
 ---> <CrtImplementationDetails>.ModuleLoadException: The C++ module failed to load during appdomain initialization.

 ---> System.DllNotFoundException: dwrite.dll
 ---> System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception (126): The specified module could not be found.
```

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

_No response_

Issues.Title: contextmenu disappears when a WPF usercontrol is displayed in a WinForm Form (using an element host)
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 6.0 
.NET 7.0 
Tested on both

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

.net 4.8

### Issue description

There is a bug when a WPF usercontrol is displayed in a Winform Form (using an element host).
If this WPF usercontrol has a context menu, and the scaling in Windows Display Settings are different than 100% (125% for exemple). Then if we try to pass the mouse over the menu items, they disappearâ€¦ It makes impossible for the user to select an item in the menu (making this a blocking issue for one of our project).

This issue is only appearing if the WPF usercontrol is used in a WinForms application. If the same control is copied in a full WPF app, there is no problem. I guess there is some mechanism with the scaling and WinForms that has a small thing to fix.

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/1432610/8447c550-0f14-4790-a97a-8afb9080e077)


### Steps to reproduce

I have created a small demo project under : 
[https://github.com/stivoberlin/WinFormsAppSetHighDpiModeBug2](https://github.com/stivoberlin/WinFormsAppSetHighDpiModeBug2)

If you want to create a new project from scratch : 
Create a WinForm Application, with a winforms form
Create a WPF Usercontrol with a context menu and some menu items
Put the WPF Usercontrol in the WinForms Form
Set your windows scaling to 125% (in the Windows Display Settings for the screen)
Start the app, and try to select the last item of the context menu. They disappear.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "contextmenu disappears when a WPF usercontrol is displayed in a WinForm Form (using an element host)" (#7960)
